thig6.4:1.2: bestrewn with sandalwood and garlands of flowers,
thig6.4:1.4: honored by a following of servants.
thig6.4:2.2: with a substantial quantity of staples and delicacies.
thig6.4:3.1: Having enjoyed and amused myself there,
thig6.4:3.2: I went back to my own house.
thig6.4:3.3: In order to see the monastic dwelling place,
thig6.4:3.4: I went into the Añjana forest of Sāketa.
thig6.4:4.1: Having seen the lamp of the world,
thig6.4:4.2: I sat down after paying respect.
thig6.4:4.3: The one who knows taught me the Dhamma
thig6.4:5.3: There I saw the stainless Dhamma,
thig6.4:6.3: Obtained are the three higher knowledges,
thig6.4:6.4: the teaching of the Buddha was not in vain."
